rationale: Development of application systems and software that use underlying architecture of machines efficiently and effectively requires the ability to use and manipulate various types of Data Structures and other constructs. This being a fundamental ability which is language neutral yet requires use of a language for its implementation. This is a basic course which goes along with other programming courses to develop an integrated ability to efficient software development, hence this course is very important for computer engineers.

courseOutcomes.description: Comprehend the basic concepts of data structures, analysis terms, OOPs concepts, and recursive functions.
Apply basic operations on stack, queue and linked list data structures.
Apply basic operations on linked list data structure.
Apply different sorting and searching algorithms to small data sets.
Illustrate algorithms to insert, delete and search a node in tree.

courseContent.unitTitle: Basic Concepts of Data Structures & OOP
content: Analysis Terms (for definitions only): Time Complexity, Space Complexity, Asymptotic Notations, Big 'O' Notation, Best case Time Complexity, Average case Time Complexity, Worst case Time Complexity
Types of methods: Instance method, Class method, static method
Application of Stack - Infix, Prefix and Postfix Forms of Expressions, Evaluations of postfix expression, Recursive Functions (Factorial, Fibonacci series)
Operations on Queue - Enqueue and Dequeue
Differentiate circular queue and simple queue

Basic operations on singly linked list: Insertion of a new node in the beginning of the list, at the end of the list, after a given node, before a given node, Deleting the first and last node from a linked list, Count the number of nodes in linked list
Difference between circular linked list and singly linked list
Searching an element into List: Linear Search, Binary Search
Sorting Methods: Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, Quick Sort, Insertion Sort, Merge Sort
Binary trees: Complete Binary Tree, Basic Terms: level number, degree, in-degree and out-degree, leaf node
Binary Search Tree: Insertion of a node in binary tree, Deletion of a node in binary tree, Searching a node in binary tree

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Design a student class for reading and displaying the student information, the getInfo() and displayInfo() methods will be used respectively. Where getInfo() will be a private method.
Design a class Complex for adding the two complex numbers and show the use of constructor.

Write Python class to represent a bank account. The class contains account holder name, account number, type of account and balance amount as the data members. The member functions are as follows: to initialize the data members, to deposit an amount, to withdraw an amount after checking balance, and to display name and balance.

Write Python class to represent a Cricketer. The class contains name of cricketer, team name and run as the data members. The member functions are as follows: to initialize the data members, to set run and display run.
Implement push and pop algorithms of stack using list.
Implement a program to convert infix notation to postfix notation using stack.
Implement a program to implement queue using list that performs following operations: enqueue, dequeue, display
Implement various program to perform operation on singly linked list.
Implement program to create and display circular linked list.
Implement program to perform following operation on doubly linked list: traversal, searching, adding and removing node.
Implement a Python program to search a particular element from list using Linear and Binary Search.
Implement Selection sort and Insertion sort algorithm.
Implement construction of binary search trees.
Write a menu driven program to perform different operation on Binary Search Tree

performanceIndicators.indicator: Correctness of program & approach to implement logic
Readability and documentation of the program/Quality of input and output displayed (messaging and formatting)
Use Python concepts to implement efficient program

laboratoryResources.specifications: Windows 7 or higher version, macOS, and Linux, with 4GB or higher RAM, Python versions: 2.7.X, 3.6.X or higher

laboratoryResources.resourceName: Python IDEs and Code Editors Open Source

projectList.title: Arithmetic Expression Evaluator
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program that evaluates the given arithmetic expression using stack.

projectList.title: Person Queue Management
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program that maintains a queue of persons. In this queue user can add a person, delete a person and search a person.

projectList.title: Banking Operations System
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program that performs banking operations like withdraw cash, deposit cash and mini statement using appropriate data structure.

projectList.title: Process Management Algorithm
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program for process management algorithm by using appropriate data structure.

projectList.title: Print Spooler
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program for print spooler using appropriate Data structure.

projectList.title: Telephone Directory System
projectList.description: Develop a Python Program for Telephone Directory system. In this user can add, search, modify, list, and delete records through the use of appropriate data structure.

projectList.title: Phone Directory using Doubly-Linked Lists
projectList.description: This project can demonstrate the working of contact book applications and also teach you about data structures like arrays, linked lists, stacks, and queues. Typically, phone book management encompasses searching, sorting, and deleting operations. A distinctive feature of the search queries here is that the user sees suggestions from the contact list after entering each character.

projectList.title: Hangman Game
projectList.description: The Hangman program randomly selects a secret word from a list of secret words. A random word (e.g., a fruit name) is picked up from our collection and the player gets limited chances to win the game. When a letter in that word is guessed correctly, that letter position in the word is made visible. In this way, all letters of the word are to be guessed before all the chances are over.

projectList.title: Stack and Queue Implementation using Linked List
projectList.description: Develop a Python program that implements stack and queue operations using linked list representation.

studentActivities: Provide students with code snippets and ask them to identify the Big O notation for each one.
Visit Code.org - an hour of code may be organized and students are encouraged to participate.
Students are encouraged to register themselves in various MOOCs such as: Swayam, EdX, Coursera, Udemy etc. to further enhance their learning.
List the applications which are developed using Python data structures.
Encourage students to participate in different coding competitions like hackathon, online competitions on CodeChef etc.
Encourage students to form a coding club at institute level and can help the slow learners.

books.author: Rance D. Necaise
